title: How do we end a diary entry? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you wish to include an ending to an entry but remain personal, you can say something like, that's all I have today, goodnight dear diary. When you write in your diary, you're writing to yourself; you're sort of talking to yourself. So you can end it by telling yourself goodnight. Some answers are saying it's a personal and informal experience that is entirely yours… it is, but it is also a more formal method of talking to yourself, so having a little structure is okay in that sense. Here's a great example of an ending to a short inquiry response: That's how I would do it anyway. Your way is up to you. Good luck.

How do we end a diary entry?  Choices: A period, like “.”“Goodnight — and good luck.”“And that’s the news for today.”“. . . to be continued . . . uh . . . maybe?”“Gotta pee.”“That’s all folks.”“This day’s events were recorded in front of an invisible audience in my bedroom.”“And remember kids: M-I-C-K-E-Y (pause) M>O>U>S>E.”“I could tell you more, but then I’d have to kill you.”“Coming up . . .”Natch, there are SO many more. Get creative!
